Dec 3 - 3i Infrastructure is buying the remaining 50% it does not already own in Esvagt, the service operation vessel operator for the offshore wind industry, for £268m from AMP Capital. Offers were invited to buy the entire company but in the end 3i Infrastructure took up its share option after the binding offers were said to be not high enough. The purchase price is an 18% premium to 3i Infrastructure's carrying value on September 30. Deutsche Bank and JP Morgan advised on the sale. The sellers were originally said to be looking at a price of DKr6bn (£660m).

(Reporting by Rod Morrison)
